nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.stats
Class StatisticalServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
  nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.stats.StatisticalServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service, StatisticalService, StatisticalServiceLocal
Direct Known Subclasses:
StatisticalActivityServiceImpl, StatisticalFinancesServiceImpl, StatisticalKeyDevelopmentsServiceImpl, StatisticalTaxesServiceImpl
public abstract class StatisticalServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements StatisticalServiceLocal

general implementation of StatisticalService; contains general methods for all child classes.

Author:
Rinke

Method Detail

calculatePvalue

protected static StatisticalNumber calculatePvalue(double[] array1,
                                                   double[] array2)
Calculates the p-value from two sample arrays. It is basically a wrapper around the if's.

Parameters:
array1 -
array2 -
Returns:
a StatisticalNumber indicating the p-value. If one of the sizes is too small, then a null pvalue is returned.

calculatePvalue

protected static StatisticalNumber calculatePvalue(int proportion1,
                                                   int population1,
                                                   int proportion2,
                                                   int population2)
Calculates the p-value from two proportion samples.

Parameters:
proportion1 - the number of observations fulfilling the specific criteria in group 1, for example the number of members not trading.
population1 - the total number of observations in group 1, for example the total number of members not trading.
proportion2 - same as proportion1, but for the other group.
population2 - same as population2, but for the other group.
Returns:
the pvalue as a statisticalNumber.

calculatePvalue

protected static StatisticalNumber calculatePvalue(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> list1,
                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.Number> list2)
Calculates the p-value from two sample Lists. Is exactly the same as calculatePvalue(double[], double[]), only accepts different input type params.

Parameters:
list1 - a List of Numbers being the first sample
list2 - a List of Numbers being the second sample
Returns:
a StatisticalNumber indicating the p-value. If one of the sizes is too small, then a null pvalue is returned.

setMaximumDataPoints

public void setMaximumDataPoints(int maximumDataPoints)
Description copied from interface: StatisticalService
sets the maximum number of datapoints which the user can request. A datapoint is one statistical calculation via sql. The default value is 1000. Set this from the prepareForm method in the action, and only if you want another maximum than the default of 1000.

Specified by:
setMaximumDataPoints in interface StatisticalService

createDataObject

@Deprecated
protected StatisticalResultDTO createDataObject(int rows,
                                                           int columns,
                                                           int factor,
                                                           byte precision)
Deprecated. only used for testing

This version is used for other typed tables, which just simply show any kind of data in rows or columns. There is no growth or p-value column, as in the overloaded version of this method.

Returns:
the StatisticalResultDTO object, with only the data set. Other elements still need to be set

createDataObject

@Deprecated
protected StatisticalResultDTO createDataObject(int rows,
                                                           int columns,
                                                           int[] rowFactor,
                                                           byte precision)
Deprecated. only used for testing

See createDataObject(int rows, int columns, int factor). This overloaded version takes an int array (int[]) for the factor param, so every row can have its own factor.

Parameters:
rows -
columns -

createDataObject

@Deprecated
protected StatisticalResultDTO createDataObject(int rows,
                                                           int tableFactor,
                                                           StatisticalService.TableType tableType,
                                                           byte precision)
Deprecated. only used for testing

Creates a result table with random values for a table comparing two periods. So generally, the first column is the result for this period, 2nd column is compared period. There is always a third, column, and sometimes a 4th, depending on the tableType param.

Returns:
the StatisticalResultDTO object, with only the data set. Other elements still need to be set

createDataObject

@Deprecated
protected StatisticalResultDTO createDataObject(int rows,
                                                           int[] rowFactors,
                                                           StatisticalService.TableType tableType,
                                                           byte precision)
Deprecated. only used for testing

Overloaded version of createDataObject(int rows, int factor, TableType tableType), which takes in stead of the int factor, an array of ints. Each row then gets its own factor.

getCurrency

protected Currency getCurrency(StatisticalQuery queryParameters)
tries to get the associated Currency via several methods. If all of these fail, an empty currency is returned, resulting in empty strings as name and symbol for the currency.

Parameters:
queryParameters -
Returns:
the associated currency.

getElementDao

protected ElementDAO getElementDao()

getInitializedPaymentFilter

protected PaymentFilter getInitializedPaymentFilter(StatisticalQuery queryParameters)
gets the paymentFilter from the query, and initializes it via the fetchService. The paymentFilter is then reset in the query, but also returned by the method.

Parameters:
queryParameters -
Returns:
an initialized paymentFilter.

getInitializedPaymentFilters

protected java.util.Collection<PaymentFilter> getInitializedPaymentFilters(StatisticalQuery queryParameters)
gets the paymentFilters from the query, and initializes each of the containing filter via the fetchService. PaymentFilters is then reset in the query, but it is also returned by this method.
Note the difference between getInitializedPaymentFilter and getInitializedPaymentFilters. The first is for a selector in which only one paymentFilter may be selected; the second is for a selector where multiple payment filters may be selected.

Parameters:
queryParameters - the query
Returns:
a collection with initialized paymentFilters

getRowHeaders

protected java.lang.String getRowHeaders(ThroughTimeRange throughTimeRange,
                                         Period period)
Generates the row headers in the table in through time: the names of the months, quarters or years

Parameters:
throughTimeRange - the type of the range (month, year, etc)
period - one period inside this range. It is called once for every period inside the range.
Returns:
a String representing the row header of the table.

parenthesizeString

protected java.lang.String parenthesizeString(java.lang.String inputString)
parentesizes a String, which means that it puts the String inside (). Used for graph axis units and column subheaders.

Parameters:
inputString - the String to be parentesized
Returns:
the inputString with ( ) around it. Only if the inputString is empty, an empty string without () is returned.

passes the used GroupFilter to the result object.

Parameters:
result - a StatisticalResultDTO object containing the results.
queryParameters -

passPaymentFilter

protected void passPaymentFilter(StatisticalResultDTO result,
                                 StatisticalQuery queryParameters)
passes the used PaymentFilter to the result object. The following possibilities are there:
  • paymentFilter property: passes the paymentFilter
  • paymentFilters property: only passes the paymentFilter if the size of the paymentFilters collection is 1. Then it passes the only element. If the size > 1, then nothing is passed.

On the fly, the paymentfilter is initialized.

Parameters:
result - a StatisticalResultDTO object containing the results.
queryParameters -

passSystemAccountFilter

protected void passSystemAccountFilter(StatisticalResultDTO result,
                                       StatisticalQuery queryParameters)
passes the used System account Filter to the result object.

Parameters:
result - a StatisticalResultDTO object containing the results.
queryParameters -
